name: King Abgar V of Edessa
displayName: King Abgar V Ukkama - First Christian Monarch
shortDescription: King of Osroene who corresponded with Jesus Christ and was healed by the apostle Thaddaeus, becoming the first monarch to embrace Christianity
longDescription: King Abgar V (reigned c. 4 BCE - 7 CE and 13-50 CE), called Ukkama ('the Black'), was the ruler of the Kingdom of Osroene centered at Edessa (modern Sanliurfa, Turkey). According to Syriac tradition preserved in the Doctrine of Addai and recorded by the church historian Eusebius, Abgar suffered from a severe illness (possibly leprosy) and, having heard of Jesus's miraculous healings, sent a letter to Christ requesting healing. Jesus replied with a letter blessing those who believed without seeing and promising that after his ascension, a disciple would come to heal and teach. After Pentecost, the apostle Thaddaeus (called Addai in Syriac) was sent to Edessa, where he healed King Abgar and converted him to Christianity. Some versions of the legend include the miraculous 'Image of Edessa' (Mandylion) - Christ's image miraculously imprinted on cloth and sent to Abgar. Abgar became the first king to make Christianity his personal faith, though official adoption would come centuries later. The Abgar correspondence was once believed genuine, preserved in church archives, though modern scholars consider it legendary. Nevertheless, it attests to very early Christianity in Edessa and the East.

biography.earlyLife: Member of the Abgarid dynasty that ruled Osroene as client kings

majorEvents.description: Ruled Osroene c. 4 BCE - 7 CE before temporary removal
Restored to throne c. 13 CE, ruled until c. 50 CE
Sent letter to Jesus requesting healing; received blessed reply promising a disciple would come
After Pentecost, the apostle Thaddaeus came to Edessa and healed Abgar of his illness
Abgar and many of his court accepted Christianity through Thaddaeus's preaching
According to some traditions, received the miraculous image of Christ's face (Mandylion)

achievements: First monarch to personally embrace Christianity
Invited apostolic mission to his kingdom
Preserved in tradition as model of royal faith
Associated with the miraculous Image of Edessa
biography.legacy: Abgar became a prototype of the Christian monarch, a king who sought Christ and welcomed the Gospel. While modern historians question the historical accuracy of the correspondence tradition, it attests to the antiquity of Christianity in Edessa. The Abgar legend influenced later traditions of Christian kings receiving miraculous images and relics.
